text:
We have a configuration where we use both IIS and Tomcat 4 on a single machine, 
both running on port 80. Each has a dedicated IP address and IIS is configured 
to not use socket pooling.

This configuration works fine with TC4.0.4b2 using the old http1.1 connector, 
but using Coyote 1.0-b8 I get the following error. (The same applies for 
TC4.1.0 Alpha)

Platform: Win 2k, Sun JDK1.3.1_02
<snip from stderr>
[INFO] Http11Protocol - -setAttribute port 80
[INFO] Http11Protocol - -setAttribute maxThreads 300
[INFO] Http11Protocol - -setAttribute backlog 100
[INFO] Http11Protocol - -setAttribute tcpNoDelay true
[INFO] Http11Protocol - -setAttribute soTimeout 60000
[INFO] Http11Protocol - -setAttribute timeout 60000
[INFO] Http11Protocol - -setAttribute secure false
java.net.BindException: Address in use: JVM_Bind:80
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.PoolTcpEndpoint.startEndpoint
(PoolTcpEndpoint.java:267)
	at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol.init(Http11Protocol.java:141)
	at org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.CoyoteConnector.initialize
(CoyoteConnector.java:995)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardService.initialize
(StandardService.java:568)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardServer.initialize
(StandardServer.java:746)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.start(Catalina.java:503)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.execute(Catalina.java:399)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.process(Catalina.java:179)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.main(Bootstrap.java:203)
[ERROR] Http11Protocol - -Error initializing endpoint <java.net.BindException: 
Address in use: JVM_Bind:80>

<snip from stdout>
Catalina.start: LifecycleException:  Protocol handler initialization failed: 
java.net.BindException: Address in use: JVM_Bind:80
LifecycleException:  Protocol handler initialization failed: 
java.net.BindException: Address in use: JVM_Bind:80
	at org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.CoyoteConnector.initialize
(CoyoteConnector.java:997)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardService.initialize
(StandardService.java:568)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardServer.initialize
(StandardServer.java:746)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.start(Catalina.java:503)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.execute(Catalina.java:399)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.process(Catalina.java:179)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.main(Bootstrap.java:203)
Catalina.stop: LifecycleException:  This server has not yet been started
LifecycleException:  This server has not yet been started
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardServer.stop(StandardServer.java:720)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.start(Catalina.java:535)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.execute(Catalina.java:399)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.process(Catalina.java:179)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.main(Bootstrap.java:203)


Here is my connector config....
<Connector className="org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.CoyoteConnector" port="80" 
address="10.1.1.228"  minProcessors="25" maxProcessors="300" 
enableLookups="true" redirectPort="443" acceptCount="100" debug="9" 
connectionTimeout="60000" useURIValidationHack="false" />
creator: cbritton@metatomix.com

text: Fixed. Thanks. Coyote b9, 4.0.4 Beta 3, 4.1.1 will have the fix.
creator: remm@apache.org
remm@apache.org
text: *** Bug 8921 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
